distribution.text: Copyright © Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
Updated file packages that fix multiple security issues and several bugs
are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having Moderate security
impact. Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base scores, which give
detailed severity ratings, are available for each vulnerability from the
CVE links in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The file command is used to identify a particular file according to the 
type of data the file contains. It can identify many different file 
types, including Executable and Linkable Format (ELF) binary files, 
system libraries, RPM packages, and different graphics formats.

Multiple denial of service flaws were found in the way file parsed certain
Composite Document Format (CDF) files. A remote attacker could use either
of these flaws to crash file, or an application using file, via a specially
crafted CDF file. (CVE-2014-0207, CVE-2014-0237, CVE-2014-0238,
CVE-2014-3479, CVE-2014-3480, CVE-2014-3487, CVE-2014-3587)

Two flaws were found in the way file processed certain Pascal strings. A
remote attacker could cause file to crash if it was used to identify the
type of the attacker-supplied file. (CVE-2014-3478, CVE-2014-9652)

Multiple flaws were found in the file regular expression rules for
detecting various files. A remote attacker could use these flaws to cause
file to consume an excessive amount of CPU. (CVE-2014-3538)

Multiple flaws were found in the way file parsed Executable and Linkable
Format (ELF) files. A remote attacker could use these flaws to cause file
to crash, disclose portions of its memory, or consume an excessive amount
of system resources. (CVE-2014-3710, CVE-2014-8116, CVE-2014-8117,
CVE-2014-9653)

Red Hat would like to thank Thomas Jarosch of Intra2net AG for reporting
the CVE-2014-8116 and CVE-2014-8117 issues. The CVE-2014-0207,
CVE-2014-0237, CVE-2014-0238, CVE-2014-3478, CVE-2014-3479, CVE-2014-3480,
CVE-2014-3487, CVE-2014-3710 issues were discovered by Francisco Alonso of
Red Hat Product Security; the CVE-2014-3538 issue was discovered by Jan
Kaluža of the Red Hat Web Stack Team

The file packages have been updated to ensure correct operation on Power
little endian and ARM 64-bit hardware architectures. (BZ#1224667,
BZ#1224668, BZ#1157850, BZ#1067688).

All file users are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain backported patches to correct these issues.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: file security and bug fix update

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: A denial of service flaw was found in the way the File Information (fileinfo) extension parsed certain Composite Document Format (CDF) files. A remote attacker could use this flaw to crash a PHP application using fileinfo via a specially crafted CDF file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: file: cdf_read_short_sector insufficient boundary check
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue does not affect the file, php, or php53 packages in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 and 6. This issue affects the file package in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact, a future update my address this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: A denial of service flaw was found in the way the File Information (fileinfo) extension parsed certain Composite Document Format (CDF) files. A remote attacker could use this flaw to crash a PHP application using fileinfo via a specially crafted CDF file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: file: cdf_unpack_summary_info() excessive looping DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This issue did not affect the php and the file packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

This issue affects the versions of file as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

cwe.name: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

notes.text: A denial of service flaw was found in the way the File Information (fileinfo) extension parsed certain Composite Document Format (CDF) files. A remote attacker could use this flaw to crash a PHP application using fileinfo via a specially crafted CDF file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: file: CDF property info parsing nelements infinite loop
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This issue did not affect the php and the file packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

This issue affects the versions of file as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: A buffer overflow flaw was found in the way the File Information (fileinfo) extension processed certain Pascal strings. A remote attacker able to make a PHP application using fileinfo convert a specially crafted Pascal string provided by an image file could cause that application to crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: file: mconvert incorrect handling of truncated pascal string size
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This issue did not affect the versions of file, php, and php53 as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 and 6.

This issue affects the versions of file as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: Multiple flaws were found in the File Information (fileinfo) extension regular expression rules for detecting various files. A remote attacker could use either of these flaws to cause a PHP application using fileinfo to consume an excessive amount of CPU.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: file: unrestricted regular expression matching
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

notes.text: It was found that the fix for CVE-2012-1571 was incomplete; the File Information (fileinfo) extension did not correctly parse certain Composite Document Format (CDF) files. A remote attacker could use this flaw to crash a PHP application using fileinfo via a specially crafted CDF file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: file: incomplete fix for CVE-2012-1571 in cdf_read_property_info
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This issue did not affect the php and the file packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

This issue affects the versions of file as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

notes.text: An out-of-bounds read flaw was found in the way the File Information (fileinfo) extension parsed Executable and Linkable Format (ELF) files. A remote attacker could use this flaw to crash a PHP application using fileinfo via a specially crafted ELF file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: file: out-of-bounds read in elf note headers

notes.text: An ouf-of-bounds read flaw was found in the way the file utility processed certain Pascal strings. A remote attacker could cause an application using the file utility (for example, PHP using the fileinfo module) to crash if it was used to identify the type of the attacker-supplied file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: file: out of bounds read in mconvert()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

notes.text: A flaw was found in the way the File Information (fileinfo) extension parsed Executable and Linkable Format (ELF) files. A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause a PHP application using fileinfo to crash or disclose certain portions of server memory.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: file: malformed elf file causes access to uninitialized memory
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
